DOC.brief_summary: Women undergoing elective cesarean delivery, performed under a standard spinal anesthesia, will be randomized to undergo either TAP block or incisional infiltration with local anesthetic, in addition to standard postoperative analgesia comprising regular acetaminophen, nefopam and ketoprofen. Short acting oral morphine will be given as a rescue treatment in case of severe pain.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Two Types of Pain Relief After Cesarean Delivery
DOC.criteria: scheduled cesarean section performed under spinal anesthesia ASA I or II height above 1,55 m singleton pregnancy contre indication to a drug used in the study (levobupivacaine, ketoprofen, nefopam)
